resources.string: Tap on a topic below to learn more about it.

Your pin is a string of numbers that is used to identify you. You will need to remember it, as it is needed to change settings and use certain commands.\nYour pin must be at least 4 numbers long, with no maximum.\nTo ensure that your pin stays secure, it is only stored in an encrypted format.

Your keyword is a one-word phrase that is used to address SMSLocator. It is the word that you begin your text message with to instruct SMSLocator to process the message.\nTo ensure that it doesn\'t come up in a normal conversation, you should include letters, numbers, and symbols in your keyword.

SMSLocator allows you to limit who can interact with it on your phone. You can enter phone numbers of people whom you trust so that only those numbers are allowed. [br][b]It is [u]extremely[/u] important that you will be able to use the devices that the numbers belong to. If you don\'t, you will not be able to talk to SMSLocator as long as the restriction is enabled. Be sure to keep the list up to date![/b][br]Phone numbers must include a + then the country code (ex. +1 for North America). For example, +12345678910
Below is a list of all the commands you can send SMSLocator. Commands marked with (*) are only available with the premium upgrade.
